snippet: The agreement would leave Bernard Arnault, the head of LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton, with about 8.5 percent of Hermès International and end a bitter four-year battle.
abstract: Bernard Arnault and Hermes chief executive Axel Dumas strike deal that luxury giant LVMH Moet Hennessey Louis Vuitton, which Arnault controls, will spin off its entire Hermes stake to LVMH shareholders; agreement ends bitter four-year battle and threat that Arnault could seize control of venerable family-owned Hermes, although he retains residual stake of 8.5 percent.

byline.contributor: Vanessa Friedman contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The agreement would leave Bernard Arnault, the head of LVMH Moët Hennessy Louis Vuitton, with about 8.5 percent of Hermès International and end a bitter four-year battle.
